Subject: Re: Installing Cantera on Mac OS X
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=157334857; y=AX9VoKs5W0SLvszRBlmGYidJwX0TDcNWZKwfBfntQsD17BZMrvA4yQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: kevinmwalters

I am running cantera (from the mac os installer, OSX 10.4 on a G4
laptop) a=
nd I encountered a problem similar to the one you first
encountered (Python=
 couldn't locate OneD).  It looks like the mac os
installer doesn't include=
 the python OneD files.  The work-around that
resolved the problem for me w=
as download the Cantera 1.60 source R2
and copy the folder cantera-1.6.0r2/=
Cantera/python/Cantera/OneD to
/library/Python/2.3/Cantera/

Hope this is o=
f some help.

Unfortunately, I can't help with the compile errors.

-- Kevi=
n

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "jocie_squirl" <jocie_squirl@...> wrote:=

>
> Hello all!
> I was wondering if someone can help me with some installa=
tion
> questions with a Mac OS X (10.3).  I should start by saying that up
=
> until a week ago, Cantera was on my machine and working fine from
> Matla=
b, however, I wanted to run it through Python and kept getting an
> error t=
o the extent of can't find Cantera.oneD or something like
> that).  Since I=
 am a novice python user, I am not sure if this is
> something wrong in the=
 Cantera or in the Python, or, most likely, in
> the user.  
> 
> In a perh=
aps foolish attempt to fix the problem, I uninstalled Cantera
> then I retr=
ieved Cantera off the CVS directory (after updating my
> python and install=
ing sundials), then ran the ./preconfig (not sure if
> it is a problem that=
 I get the line: checking for matlab... none  when
> Matlab is installed on=
 my computer and I have run the mex -setup). 
> When I run the make file fo=
r this, however, I am getting errors to the
> extent of:
> make[1]: *** [OD=
E_integrators.o] Error 1
> make: *** [kernel] Error 2
> (the full text retu=
rn is reprinted below).  I should mention that the
> sundials flag in the p=
reconfig file is turned to y (I get different
> errors if it is turned to n=
), I have Sundials 2.2.0, and when I look
> for the scripts that it is look=
ing for (i.e. nvector.h), they exist on
> my computer in the Cantera direct=
ory, but there is only
> sundials_fnvector.h in the sundials directory.
> 
=
> Can anyone help me make the errors go away?  
> 
> Thanks!
> Jocelyn
>
